result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber J Hopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant may petition Court in writing, after 2 years, for expunction of both cases, contingent upon successful completion of probation, no new law violations and costs and restitution paid in full.
Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. no contact T.D., maintain full-time work, school or doing an active search for work.

timeConds.notes: AMENDED 6/1/15: Jail time to be from May 29, 2015 to July 24, 2015, as a condition of probation due to probation violations or until the birth of the child, whichever occurs first

ADDRESS INFO for Amber J Hopp
Current: 431 1/2 B East Main St, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 10-16-2014)
Prior: 313 1/2 Main Street Apt. A, Waupun, WI 53963

Cases heard: 14CF221 & 14CF405, Defendant Amber J Hopp in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 6&7 in 14CF221 and to 14CF405 as amended to misdemeanor bailjumping. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. no contact T.D., $1,000 restitution in 14CF221 case, $443 costs on each count, maintain full-time work, school or doing an active search for work.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after 2 years, for expunction of both cases, contingent upon successful completion of probation, no new law violations and costs and restitution paid in full. Jail credit - 7 days in 14CF405, 2 days in 14CF221. Ct. 5 in 14CF221 read in and dismissed. Amended Complaint in 14CF405 to be filed today.
filed by Atty Genda
with Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Genda
